front.title: Setting up Mbus Control Sessions with SIP and SDP

abstract.t: Mbus (Message Bus for Local Coordination) was designed for use on individual hosts, subnets, or small multicast networks. This document describes how to setup an Mbus control session using SIP and SDP. Using SIP to setup Mbus allows for authentication, negotiation of an Mbus secret key, and facilitates NAT and firewall traversal.
